title: Validate property state before creating BuildingSync document
body:
#### Any background context you want to provide?
To generate a BETTER analysis SEED first constructs a BuildingSync document to be used as input for a BETTER analysis. In the creation of this document, the function calls on a given PropertyStates city, state, and postal_code.

There are currently guards against running a BETTER analysis if the PropertyState is missing city or state, but not postal_code

#### What's this PR do?
validates the property states geographic info before creating a buildingsync document.

#### How should this be manually tested?
Run an analysis with no postal code. The error message should be informative.

#### What are the relevant tickets?
#3946

body:

title: Increase AnalysisMessage.user_message length
body:
#### Any background context you want to provide?
In the BETTER Analysis workflow, any error messages retrieved from a BETTER response will be saved on the AnalysisMessage model. The current database length of these messages is set to 255 and any messages longer than 255 will be truncated and a '...' placed on the end. Once this happens there is no way to retrieve the whole message. 

#### What's this PR do?
Increases the length of `user_messages `and `debug_messages` from 255 to 1024.

#### How should this be manually tested?
Create a BETTER analysis when a property has no `property-type` set. Check the analysis for the full error message.

#### What are the relevant tickets?
#3891

title: GitHub Actions is unnecessarily masking output
body:
**Describe the bug**
GitHub Actions masks log output for every instance of the value of a repo secret.  When using weak secrets it can effectively leak them.  The current issue is that a non-secret, `SF_DOMAIN=test`, is resulting in CI logs like this:

> ![GitHubActionsSecrets](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/411466/227341431-ab8965c7-9ff5-405c-8a3e-b34bf4805226.png)

**Expected Behavior**
The log output should not obscure non-secret test/database names.

**Actual Behavior**
Every instance of the text `test` was replaced with `***` in the log output

title: Filter cycle specific labels on inventory list
body:
#### Any background context you want to provide?
The new Inventory List page's filter auto-complete shows all labels that are associated with any property, in any cycle. This differs from the functionality on Inventory List (legacy) page where only labels associated with the cycle's inventory are present.

#### What's this PR do?
- Adds cycle-specific inventory filters to the returned labels. The prior functionality returned all labels that have been applied to a property regardless of cycle.
- Changes the order of function calls. For context, the filter labels function generated labels and then found the cycle's inventory. However, to accurately filter labels the inventory (`$scope.data`) must first exist. 

#### How should this be manually tested?
- create at least 2 cycles. 
- apply cycle specific labels to a few properties
- apply cross-cycle labels to a few properties
- click the "Filter by Label" input field. The auto-complete should only include labels applied to this cycle.

#### What are the relevant tickets?
#3818

#### Screenshots (if appropriate)

2 cycles with unique and common labels.

body:
#### Any background context you want to provide?
Compliance calculations were not casting the data types before checking causing the front end to not show data.

#### What's this PR do?
* Move the `DATA_TYPE_PARSERS` that was in `search.py` to the Column class. 
* Adds a class method and instance method to cast data from the column. It is only one value at a time at the moment

* Write a bunch of test cases for casting data
* Update the pre-commit versions

title: Sort column mappings in profile before export
body:
#### Any background context you want to provide?
The column mapping export data was being exported in order of IDs, which was reasonable; however, in orgs with lots of column mappings (~1,000) it appeared that all the data was not being exported. One of the reasons was that the view on the website did not match the view in the exported file.

#### What's this PR do?
* Sort (case insensitive) the column mappings before export

#### How should this be manually tested?
* In SF org (or any other org), go to column mappings
* Export and verify that the to_field is sorted alphabetically and consistent with the results in the SEED UI.

body:
#### Any background context you want to provide?
When we revised the code to accept the new ESPM format for monthly meter usage, there ended up being an issue where the data was being added twice (so 24 months of data instead of 12 months when uploading a year's worth).

#### What's this PR do?

title: Update derived column migration to prevent conflicting column names and prevent duplicate column names
body: #### Any background context you want to provide? * See the original issue from @ebeers-png #3439 * This update makes us that *maybe* forcing column names to be unique via a database constraint would be a good idea. Uniqueness constraint would be a combination of `org`, `table_name`, and `column_name` #### What's this PR do? * updates the migration to check if the creation of the column from the derived column will result in a name conflict * adds in the `is_extra_data` to the column creations per the original issue's suggestion #### How should this be manually tested? Testing is a bit complicated since most databases have probably already run this migration. I've documented my testing in case you don't want to test this workflow. * Checkout SEED to a version before the `0170` migration existed (I used sha `d43fdfc2e`) * In a clean database since you went back to a pretty old commit, import some data * Create a derived column with the same name as an existing column * verify that you can view the two same-named columns in the property list * check out this branch and run the migrations * go to the column list profile and add in the renamed derived columns (has "derived 1" appended). * Verify the column is correctly displayed in the inventory list * Also verify that you can no longer create a derived column with an existing column name (e.g., lot_number). #### What are the relevant tickets? #3439

title: Support import of a csv file that has lots of spaces
body:
#### Any background context you want to provide?

When importing `.csv` files that have many spaces, the Python Sniffer can interpret the delimiter as a space, which causes the headers to be space-delimited instead of comma-delimited. This happen with only a large amount of rows like the ones below

```csv
id, address, a, b, c, square footage, d, total area
1,15013 Denver West Parkway,,1,," 10,000.00 ",," 10,500.00 "
2,15014 Denver West Parkway,,1,," 15,000.00 ",," 20,500.00 "
3,15015 Denver West Parkway,,1,," 20,000.00 ",," 50,500.00 "
4,15016 Denver West Parkway,,1,," 30,000.00 ",," 100,500.00 "
...
```

#### What's this PR do?
* Since it MCM parser is expecting CSV files, then force the format to be CSV if the Sniffer detects something otherwise.

#### How should this be manually tested?
* Create a long file (1000 rows) with the example above and verify it loads

#### What are the relevant tickets?
#3675 

#### Screenshots (if appropriate)

title: Fix ESPM get template with no children
body:
#### Any background context you want to provide?
non-empty arrays where parsed with `replace('"[{', '[{').replace('}]"', '}]')`, but not the empty ones. Thus, if `childrenRows` was empty, we'd try to iter through an empty array like it was a string, "[]".

Note, replacing `replace('"[{', '[{').replace('}]"', '}]')` with `replace('"[', '[').replace(']"', ']')` doesn't work, as `[` and `]` are uses in the data and it all gets messed up. 

#### What are the relevant tickets?
 #3593 [#3322](https://github.com/SEED-platform/seed/issues/3322)

title: Add tzdata dependency to docker images
body:
#### Any background context you want to provide?
In order for docker to support the `TZ` environment variable (e.g. `TZ: America/Denver`) the `tzdata` dependency must be in the base image.  Otherwise logs will only ever appear with UTC timestamps

#### What's this PR do?
Adds `tzdata`

#### What are the relevant tickets?
#3537

title: New Property List View -- filtering sometimes gives 400 / 500 errors -- needs thorough testing

labels.name: Assign
labels.description: Need to assign to someone

body:
**Describe the bug**

It seems that some of the standard filtering isn't working properly in the new Property List View

**Expected Behavior**

The filtering that works on the Legacy Property List should also work on the now default Property List viwe

**Actual Behavior**

Filtering seems to be giving 400 and 500 errors.

**Steps to Reproduce**

Filter on "Energy Star Score" for blank values by entering "".
The result is a 400 error
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6314950/191869048-c5c36702-8687-44ea-95d1-92d03f071b82.png)

The same happens when entering !"" for 'not blank records'
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6314950/191869191-fb4e72e5-286d-4106-9cce-00b450add91a.png)

In another case, I am in the process of writing a filter and before I am finished the program puts up an error
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6314950/191869558-b0a34b86-0324-4a5d-905e-e0be0c992b7e.png)
Once I have completed the filter, the program does the appropriate filter without error
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6314950/191869644-a3c6ed51-7022-4f4a-80e3-28539e2fe229.png)

This does not happen on the legacy Property List view. 

I'm sure there are many others -- this needs to be tested thoroughly.

**Instance Information**

Instance; production seed2.lbl.gov
SHA: 09736c1d6
Org: LBNL Test 200

title: Fix only collect columns that aren't related
body:
#### Any background context you want to provide?
When the backend attempted to filter on a column that had a non-unique name, it would pull the most recent column instead of the appropriatee column.  This came up when "related data" was causing the same column name to be present twice.

#### What's this PR do?
Excludes the columns with "related data" when building the list of column s by table name so the correct column should always be present.

#### How should this be manually tested?
Ensure filtering works on a field that isn't related but has a related column by the same name (such as "Address Line 1").

#### What are the relevant tickets?
https://github.com/SEED-platform/seed/issues/3499

#### Screenshots (if appropriate)

title: The meter data in this file cannot be imported
body:
Instance: dev1
SHA: 449f54dcf

I am not sure this ESPM file with meter data can be imported into SEED, but it seems like it should. 

Seems like we need a specification about what the format of meter data can be to be imported. I think I was supposed to put something together like that, but at this point, I don't know what the various formats are that can be imported, and it would be better to get a definitive answer based on the code before I try to write something up. 

Here is the file I am trying to import
[BETTER_Test_data_all_buildingtypes.xlsx](https://github.com/SEED-platform/seed/files/9294748/BETTER_Test_data_all_buildingtypes.xlsx)

It has three tabs, one for the buildings, one for the meters and one for the meter readings. 

When I import the file above, starting with "upload a spreadsheet" and then when that is finished, selecting "Import Meters from the same file", 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6314950/183765244-dd9cf7e2-7995-4460-9375-22a2a000b94d.png)
I get this error message -- I have no idea what is wrong with the file. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6314950/183765533-307b2b5e-1200-4f5c-8ee0-401f3ea59905.png)

I guess we need to provide some information to the user about what file "meets the required specifications".

title: Unable to filter inventory by derived columns

labels.name: User Support
labels.description: Issues based on user problems

body:
**Describe the bug**

I'm unable to filter the inventory by a derived column on the new/beta inventory list. It seems to work fine on the old inventory list.

**Actual Behavior**

After typing in a filter, the spinner wheel appears, and I see an error for this POST request (where "Source EUI Recalculated" is the name of the derived column):

`https://seeddemostaging.lbl.gov/api/v3/properties/filter/?Source EUI Recalculated__icontains=1&cycle=404&include_related=true&organization_id=303&page=1&per_page=100`

**Steps to Reproduce**

1. Add a derived column to a column profile.
2. Type anything into that column's filter box.

**Instance Information**

I found this error on one of ClearlyEnergy's instances of BEAM, which I'm currently updating to v2.15.1, but I confirmed that the bug was also in SEED on seeddemostaging.lbl.gov.

**Additional Context**

My error log from running BEAM locally (where the name of the column is "Derived column"):
```
File ".../seed/views/v3/properties.py", line 532, in filter
  return get_filtered_results(request, 'property', profile_id=profile_id)
File ".../seed/utils/inventory_filter.py", line 110, in get_filtered_results
  views_list = views_list.annotate(**annotations).filter(filters).order_by(*order_by)
...
File ".../.pyenv/versions/seed/lib/python3.9/site-packages/django/db/models/sql/query.py", line 1339, in build_filter
    raise FieldError('Related Field got invalid lookup: {}'.format(lookups[0]))
django.core.exceptions.FieldError: Related Field got invalid lookup: Derived column
```

body:
⚠️ this might be due to some local testing I was doing on a PR -- #3077 we might be resolving that issue there

## context
The package postoffice was added to enable sending email templates to property owners by creating email templates in the org settings, selecting the property from the inventory list, then choosing the action "email"

For some reason, celery doesn't seem to be picking up these emails

## task
- fix this so that celery is sending the emails

title: Tax Lot Inventory List View -- clicking on "i" to get to Detail view generates error

labels.name: Impact-1
labels.description: 1 - Blocker, 3 - Nicety

labels.name: Include Before Closure
labels.description: Use this label to include the issue in the CHANGELOG before the issue has been closed.

body:
**Describe the bug**
Clicking on the "i" icon to get from list to detail view in the Tax Lot tab

**Expected Behavior**
Clicking the "i" icon should get to the Tax Lot Detail view

**Actual Behavior**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6314950/140820977-8ddfa818-0d0c-4d8d-bf98-2236cc61055d.png)


**Steps to Reproduce**
From the Tax Lot List View, click on the "i" 

**Instance Information**
Instance: ad707077bc25e403eafed1eb5cc6874d-8554735.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com
SHA: 2.12.2.6a31f3d36

title: Unable to run BSyncr analysis
body: **Describe the bug** You cannot run BSyncr analyses **Expected Behavior** You should be able to run bsyncr analyses **Actual Behavior** SEED complains when you try to create the analysis: **Steps to Reproduce** Try to run a BSyncr analysis **Instance Information** SHA: 2.11.0.6247533c9 **Additional Context**

title: Analysis page fails to update analysis status after a step is "completed"
body:
**Describe the bug**
If an analysis is in an "active" state (e.g. running) SEED should poll the backend to see when the analysis status changes.

**Expected Behavior**
<!--A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.-->
Polling should continue until the analysis reaches a terminal state (failed, stopped). Also each time the analysis status changes it should be reflected on the page

**Actual Behavior**
It appears that SEED stops polling after the status changes once, and the page/item is not updated...

**Steps to Reproduce**
Start an analysis, go to analysis page. It will probably show "running" with a spinning icon. If you watch the Network tab you'll see it eventually gets 100% complete, but the analysis status on the page isn't updating...

**Instance Information**

<!--If the issue occurred on a dev, staging, or production instance, then fill in the following information. Server SHA can be obtained from going to the about page on the instance and copying the Version.-->

SHA: 2.11.0.6247533c9

**Additional Context**
This was working previously, see #2853 
It's possible that when we moved the analysis page from under the organization page that something got tweaked.

title: Recaptcha fails with local docker deployment
body: If using `docker-compose.yml` or `docker-compose.local.yml` then the site doesn't allow you to login. This is probably a combination of the recaptcha and the need to email the user.

title: Analysis cards show most recent highlights
body:
## context
You can view all previous analyses for a property in the detail analyses tab

## problem
It looks like the highlights of the cards are only shown from the most recent analysis. E.g. here the EUI should be different on the cards. When you look at the analysis page you can see the EUIs are indeed different but the cards only show the most recent value.

title: Don't download BETTER pages that should be in iframe
body:
## context
SEED renders BETTER's HTML results in an iframe when looking at an analysis run.
The file gets downloaded instead of being rendered in the iframe when in a non-development environment (e.g. dev1)

## task
- Make the iframe work properly (ie don't download)

title: Fix square footage encoding/decoding
body:
Currently we just grab the magnitude of the value, but bsync always wants sqft.

Also when parsing on BETTER's side we just pull it out but BETTER assumes the data is in m^2. So we should always be converting from ft^2 to m^2 on import

title: Fix post_office email backend
body:
SEED added post_office and email templates (#2706 )

Update common.py so that post office uses whatever our configured `EMAIL_BACKEND` is (currently it just logs to the console no matter what the environment/other settings say)

See: https://github.com/ui/django-post_office#custom-email-backends
